intro: Echites uniflorus, commonly known as the single-flower echites, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Echites uniflorus is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in warm, arid environments.
